title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 839.1 - Adopting order
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 839.1 - Adopting order

State Regulations
(a) Pursuant to
article 12 of the Public Health Law, the Water Resources Commission, after
proper study and following a public hearing conducted by the former Water

Pollution Control Board and Water Resources Commission, held on due notice, hereby adopts and assigns the following classifications and standards of
quality and purity to all surface waters within the Lake Erie drainage basin
and other drainage basins in Chautauqua County except Cattaraugus Creek and

Silver Creek drainage basins. The said drainage basins include the following
areas: (1)

That portion of Lake Erie within

New York State and bounded on the west by an extension of the New

York-Pennsylvania State Line, on the north by the international boundary, and
on the east by a line perpendicular to the west bank of Eighteenmile Creek and
extended to the international boundary. (2)

The drainage basins of streams tributary
to the portion of Lake Erie described in (1) above, excluding the drainage
basins of those streams covered in previous reports. The excluded drainage
basins are as follows: (i) Big Sister Creek
drainage basin, (Part 835, supra). (ii)

Silver Creek drainage basin, (Part 836, supra). (iii)

Cattaraugus Creek
drainage basin, (Part 838, supra). (b) This adoption and assignment of standards
of quality and purity to the above designated waters shall be effective August
9, 1965. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6
ยง
839.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
